question: Question_04_(a)
sols:
To determine the eigenvalues, $\displaystyle \lambda_{1},\,\lambda_{2}$,
of $\displaystyle A$, we solve for the characteristic polynomial of
$\displaystyle A$ for $\displaystyle \lambda$:

\begin{align*}
\det(A - \lambda I) &= 0 \\
\det\left(\left[\begin{array}{cc} 3 - \lambda & 2 \\ 2 & 3 - \lambda \end{array}  \right]\right) &= 0 \\
(3 - \lambda)^{2} - 4 &= 0 \\
(3 - \lambda)^{2}  &= 4 \\
3 - \lambda  &= \pm2 \\
\lambda &= -(-3 \pm 2) \\
\lambda &= 1 \text{ or } 5 \end{align*} Thus, the eigenvalues of ${\color{blue}\displaystyle A}$are ${\color{blue}\displaystyle \lambda_{1} = 1, \,\lambda_{2} = 5}$.
hints:
The eigenvalues $\displaystyle \lambda_{i}$ of $\displaystyle A$ satisfy
the equation

\begin{align*}\displaystyle \det(A - \lambda_{i} I) = 0\end{align*} where $\displaystyle I$ is
the identity matrix with the same dimensions as $\displaystyle A$.
